title: Variable Naming Rules
content:
## The Rules for Variable Names

Python has strict rules about what makes a valid variable name:

### Rule 1: Start with Letter or Underscore

```python
# Valid - starts with letter
name = "Alice"
age = 25
City = "NYC"

# Valid - starts with underscore
_private = "hidden"
__very_private = "more hidden"

# Invalid - starts with number
2fast = "error"  # SyntaxError
123abc = 100     # SyntaxError
```

### Rule 2: Only Letters, Numbers, and Underscores

```python
# Valid
user_name = "alice"
user2 = "bob"
first_name_1 = "charlie"

# Invalid - contains special characters
user-name = "error"   # SyntaxError (hyphen)
user.name = "error"   # SyntaxError (dot)
user@email = "error"  # SyntaxError (at sign)
user name = "error"   # SyntaxError (space)
```

### Rule 3: Case Sensitive

```python
# These are all different variables
name = "Alice"
Name = "Bob"
NAME = "Charlie"
nAmE = "Diana"

print(name)  # Alice
print(Name)  # Bob
print(NAME)  # Charlie
```

### Rule 4: Cannot Use Reserved Keywords

```python
# These will cause errors
class = "Math"     # SyntaxError
def = 10           # SyntaxError
if = True          # SyntaxError
for = "loop"       # SyntaxError

# Use alternatives
class_name = "Math"
definition = 10
is_valid = True
loop_type = "for"
```

## Naming Conventions (PEP 8)

### Variables and Functions: snake_case

```python
# Good - lowercase with underscores
user_name = "alice"
first_name = "Bob"
total_count = 42
max_retry_attempts = 3

# Bad - other styles
userName = "alice"      # camelCase (not Python style)
UserName = "alice"      # PascalCase (reserved for classes)
```

### Constants: SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE

```python
# Constants are UPPERCASE with underscores
MAX_SIZE = 100
PI = 3.14159
DATABASE_URL = "localhost:5432"
API_KEY = "secret123"
```

### Classes: PascalCase

```python
class UserAccount:
    pass

class BlogPost:
    pass
```
code:
# Variable Naming Rules - Examples

# Valid variable names
name = "Alice"
age = 25
_private = "internal"
user_name_1 = "bob"
MAX_SIZE = 100  # Constant

print("Valid names:")
print(f"name = {name}")
print(f"age = {age}")
print(f"_private = {_private}")
print(f"user_name_1 = {user_name_1}")
print(f"MAX_SIZE = {MAX_SIZE}")

# Case sensitivity
print("\nCase sensitivity:")
value = "lowercase"
Value = "capitalized"
VALUE = "uppercase"
print(f"value = {value}")
print(f"Value = {Value}")
print(f"VALUE = {VALUE}")

# Good naming examples
print("\nGood vs Bad naming:")

# Bad (unclear)
x = 86400
print(f"x = {x}  # What does this mean?")

# Good (clear)
seconds_per_day = 86400
print(f"seconds_per_day = {seconds_per_day}  # Much clearer!")

# Using underscore as throwaway variable
print("\nThrowaway variable:")
for _ in range(3):
    print("This runs 3 times")

# Common naming conventions
print("\nNaming conventions:")
print("snake_case - for variables and functions")
print("UPPER_CASE - for constants")
print("PascalCase - for classes")
print("_private - for internal/private")
